result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler A Strausser

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.5 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  The Defendant to report to WCS within one (1) business day of being released. Defendant to pay costs associated with GPS. Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items.

2:45 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Tyler A Strausser in court, in custody.  Attorney Anna M Kees in court for Tyler A Strausser. Attorney appears as friend of the court.   Victim A appeared in court.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court. 
Victim A presents a statement.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT. 
The Court puts the Defendant on notice that if it receives a WCS non-compliance letter, that the Court will forfeit bail and issue a warrant.
Hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
